projects.description:
•Trained a deep learning model based on YOLOv8 for skin cancer detection, segmentation, and classification.
•Fine-tuned the model on a public dataset, achieving 86% mAP50, 82% precision, and 83% recall for segmentation.
•Implemented visualization scripts using Matplotlib to evaluate results and assess model performance.
•Designed a Python-based workflow in Jupyter Notebook with Pandas for efficient data processing.

•Developed various algorithms in Python for automated mapping and package retrieval in a warehouse setting
•Implemented frontier exploration and RRT for efficient mapping and landmark detection using an occupancy grid
•Improved package handling precision by integrating PID controller to manage wheel velocity noise
•Applied Scikit-learn, developed an image classifier using HOG/SIFT for feature extraction and SVM for object recognition
•Implemented RANSAC for precise edge detection, ensuring perpendicular camera alignment for better imagery

•Developed an Android game using Java and XML with 5 team members, employing OOD and Agile methodologies
•Led the implementation of obstacles, collision and attack functionalities using Factory, Strategy, and Observer patterns
•Managed version control through GitHub, orchestrated sprint activities via Jira, created UML diagrams such as SD and DCD for clear system visualization, conducted 30+ unit testings within Android Studio to ensure application stability

· Worked in a team of 5 to design and prototype a Parkinson's diagnostic glove for rural communities
· Analyzed 30+ research studies to understand why rural populations are more affected by Parkinson's disease
· Proposed 5 design concepts addressing such disparity and selected the optimal one for prototyping
· Implemented an Arduino program to process raw IMU signals and trained a machine learning model in MATLAB to evaluate the risk of Parkinson’s

· Implemented and trained semantic segmentation models (PSPNet, ResNet) using PyTorch, achieving mIoU of 0.683 on the CamVid dataset
· Optimized model performance with ImageNet-pretrained backbones, data augmentation, auxiliary loss, and Pyramid Pooling Modules (PPM).
· Implemented a scalable training and evaluation pipeline in Python on Google Colab with GPU acceleration.

Developed a CPU scheduling simulation for multithreaded systems in C as a systems programming course project.
Implemented thread-safe scheduling algorithms with pthread mutexes for process synchronization and dynamic priority handling in multi-core environments.
Leveraged GDB for debugging and executed simulations on Ubuntu within a Docker container.

•Developed a pet’s facial expression classifier with 4 teammates to help pet parents better understand their pets' emotions
•Fine-tuned 3 pre-trained models (ResNet50, EfficientNetB5 and DenseNet121); leveraged Keras for deep learning pipeline implementation
•Implemented PCA preprocessing to normalize the diverse dataset, analyzed classifier performance using confusion matrix and ROC curve
•Achieved above 90% accuracy in classifying complex emotional expressions

· Developed a computer vision pipeline to match features across stereo images and calibrate camera views.
· Implemented Harris corner detection to locate interest points and crafted SIFT-like descriptors with a nearest-neighbor ratio test for reliable feature matching.
· Applied SVD and normalization to calculate projection and fundamental matrices, ensuring accurate camera alignment.
· Achieved 80% feature matching accuracy with precise 3D-to-2D mapping.

•Developed a two-lane traffic simulation using stochastic cellular automata to model traffic dynamics, incorporating randomization to reflect real-world driving behavior
•Implemented lane-specific behaviors such as acceleration, cautious lane changing with safety checks, and deceleration; used Python for simulation and Matplotlib for visualization to analyze traffic flow over time
•Enhanced understanding of traffic flow dynamics, providing insights for traffic congestions

· Achieved the First Prize and Best Engineering Notes Award at the VEX Robotic Competition Asian Open 2019
· Worked in a team of 5 to design and construct an autonomous robot to navigate the game field and compete against other robots through a series of point-scoring actions
· Developed an autopilot program that integrates various sensor inputs to facilitate maneuvering and game decisions

experiences.title: Undergraduate Researcher at Dr. Krish Roy's Lab
experiences.company: The Wallace H. Coulter Department of Biomedical Engineering at Georgia Tech and Emory University
experiences.description:
The project focuses on developing a multi-layer human lung-on-chip (microfluidics) device to study lung immune dysfunction including fibrosis and cancer. The device consists of a 3D microvasculature network and an epithelial layer at air-liquid interface separated by a membrane.
My work mainly involves creating this membrane through electrospinning biocompatible materials as well as optimizing the process parameters through SEM imaging and data analysis; manufactured the airway-vasculature structure through PDMS molding and plasma bonding for testing and experimentation.

certifications.certificate_name: Group 1 Biomedical research Investigators and Key Personnel

projects.description: The goal of this project was to develop and execute a network monitoring and scanning system to analyze network traffic, identify devices, and assess network security. In this project, I installed and configured Wireshark and Nmap to monitor and analyze network traffic and perform network scans. I also captured and analyzed network packets using Wireshark to observe traffic patterns, identify protocols, and detect anomalies. To conclude, I executed network scans with Nmap to discover active devices, open ports, and services, assessing network exposure and vulnerabilities, and documented the findings into a comprehensive report.

The aim of this project was to gain hands-on experience in reverse engineering and analyzing a variety of malware samples to understand their behavior, attack mechanisms, and potential impact on systems. Throughout this project I reverse-engineered and analyzed a diverse set of malware samples, including Michelangelo.1, DOS-7, SQLSlammer, Lucius, and Harulf to understand their code, structure, and functionality. I also utilized tools such as IDA Pro and OllyDbg to dissect and interpret the behavior of each malware sample.

Led a multi-disciplinary team in developing an interactive educational kit engaging 4th graders in STEM. Orchestrated software architecture and risk-reduction plans, contributing to software functionalities and debugging. Coordinated power system analysis and design, ensuring seamless integration with electrical components. Collaborated on mechanical design using CAD for precision parts. Successfully managed project phases, culminating in a functional prototype. Led the software sub-system of the kit which involved the user interface, mirror module, and the main file.

projects.project_name: Analyzation of a Denial-of-Service attack using Wireshark | Google Cybersecurity
projects.description: The goal of this individual project was to simulate a Denial-of-Service attack and evaluate the logs using Wireshark to depict where the attack is. This was done by looking at the Info section of the Wireshark Log. Afterwards an Incident report was constructed. In this projejct I edited the log to be color coded for attack activity and normal activity. The Log was completed by running a Wireshark search temporarily and stopping it after 50 seconds. When reading the logs, the red area indicates the attack activity and where to search for the DoS attack.

The goal of this team project was to implement a multitude of functionalities including having the neopixel controller controlling a design of the Tech Tower building of Georgia Tech, implementing a multitude of functionalities. These functionalities were decided on by meeting with the customer multiple times. As a member of the group I presented half of the total numbers of functionalities included in the project. I also implemented the functionality of controlling 256 pixels and setting a 24-bit color to any pixel, and presented the blueprint of the controller to the consumer.

projects.description:
- Developed an AI Personalized tutor for Data Structures and Algorithms as part of the Meta LlaMa subgroup at Georgia Tech over 4 months.
- Integrated features such as informational content, a Java compiler for coding tests with LlaMa feedback, conceptual questions with personalized evaluation, and a chatbot sidebar for direct interaction.

Developed an enhanced Spotify Wrapped app for CS2340 Class, focusing on custom features and user engagement over a 3-month period.
- Implemented user authentication, seamless Spotify integration, and insightful reports on top tracks, artists, and genres.
- Facilitated social interaction with a dedicated page for adding friends and sending requests within the app.
- Led as Scrum Master and Tech Support, overseeing development, UI design, task delegation, testing, and code collaboration.

- Explored augmented reality and content creation on TikTok, focusing on filter-making to delve into AR, 3D tracking, visual scripting, and generative AI.
- Achieved 1 Million views on videos featuring created filters, reaching the top 5% of all filter creators on TikTok within two months.
- Leveraged trend analysis to tailor content to popular hashtags, boosting engagement with bilingual titles and strategic filter naming.
- Mastered specific filter types, iterated with variations, and navigated algorithmic unpredictability, gaining insights into digital content marketing and honing technical skills.

Developed BabyFace, an innovative AI-driven solution at the AI ATL hackathon, collaboratively engineered with a team of 3 others, aimed at analyzing baby emotions, detecting potential dangers, and providing insightful reports to parents via SMS.
Allows parents to receive text messages about the status of their baby and the parents can text back to ask questions and BabyFace conversational AI will respond accordingly.
Utilized Python, Google Vertex AI for image Q&A and conversational AI, Twilio for text communication, Git for version control, and Redis for data storage, implementing CV2 for video capturing and flask with ngrok for server operations.
Demonstrated a strong focus on ethical considerations in AI development

Developed a student database system in C for managing student information, using linked lists for efficient data storage and retrieval while preventing memory leaks
Implemented functions for inserting in order, searching, and deleting student records based on ID, name, and GPA, ensuring accurate and fast data manipulation
Implemented choice menus to provide users with clear options for inserting, searching, and deleting student records, along with a read menu to facilitate easy navigation within the database system.

Developed an obstacle course from scratch as a challenge to implement many of the features found in other common Roblox games
Incorporates Lua scripting as well as the general Roblox Studio game builder

Programmed a text-based, interactive version of the board game Twenty-Four in the language C with a focus on order of operations with parenthesis, stack implementation, run-time, and memory leaks
Implemented a debug mode and designed an algorithm that found all possible solutions to the game

Text-based version of the online game Weaver, allowing users to find a path from a starting word to an ending word by changing one letter at a time.
Implemented a dynamic array to store words of a specific user-selected length by reading and copying from a "dictionary" file, ensuring efficient runtime performance.
Created functions for word validation, checking length and dictionary inclusion, as well as game input verification, ensuring the user's word is of the correct length and differs by only one character.
Provided an intuitive user experience by offering options to play again, play with a different word length, or exit the game, with a strong emphasis on memory management to prevent any memory leaks.

about: Hey there! I’m Nano, an Industrial Engineering student at Georgia Tech who’s passionate about solving problems and making things run smoother.Whether it’s tech, business, or operations, I enjoy finding smarter ways to get things done.Right now, I’m diving into tech consulting at Accenture, where I help clients turn our ideas into reality. It’s fast-paced, it’s challenging, and I love every second of it. I’ve also tackled process improvements at Enovis, leading projects that actually move the needle.When I’m not working, you’ll find me perfecting my swing on golf course and badminton court, or exploring seas and cultures at the same time!Looking ahead, I’m gearing up for a career that lets me keep innovating, whether that’s in consulting, project management, or supply chain.I’m here to shake things up, learn like crazy, and make a difference wherever I land. Let’s connect—I’m always up for a chat about big ideas, cool projects, or anything in between!

projects.project_name: Georgia Tech Startup Lab Refrigerator App Project: LeftOvers App
projects.description:
- Led a startup project for a mobile application that inputs 60+ foods through words/pictures, tracks the days contents have been fridge, sends customized notifications, and identifies up to 5 neighboring food banks and local shelters
- Conducted interviews of 20 potential customers per week for 15+ weeks and found 30% of interviewees often forget to eat, while 25% found value in having a shared account between roommates for communal fridges, delineating market for food conservation apps
- Mastered the basics of startups including value proposition, MVPs, startup metrics, pivoting, BMCs, and pitching in a Evidence-based Entrepreneurship course at Georgia Tech's Startup Lab

projects.project_name: Georgia Tech Objects and Design Game Dev Project: Camping Adventure Game
projects.description:
- Produced a mobile game on Android Studio using Java/XML with 3 character options based on the number of lives and 3 difficulty levels resulting in different gaming experience for 15+ weeks while utilizing the Agile methodology
- Designed a camping-themed environment, where players navigate a character across a path in a forest in a Crossy Road-like format, with differing difficulties including 3 speeds and 4 obstacle variations

projects.project_name: Georgia Tech Innovation to Prototype Security Project: Iris Obfuscation Platform
projects.description:
- Developed a biometric data protection platform advised by Dr. Wenke Lee that obfuscates iris patterns and ensuring user privacy and security in a 5-step process by preventing malicious AI from stealing iris patterns from photos
- Modified 1200 model images by manipulating Python libraries including Matplotlib, NumPy, and OpenCV through machine learning that destroys readable iris data for privacy and biometric security that are available photos online
- Pitched the project at the Innovation-2-Prototype showcase to 65+ attendees while competing against 20+ teams

projects.project_name: Georgia Tech Usable Privacy and Security Phishing Project: Research
projects.description:
- Led a group research project titled "How Phishing Affects College Students’ Cybersecurity Behavior" as part of CS4803 course on usable privacy and security which explored the effects of phishing attacks on college students' cybersecurity behavior
- Demonstrated strong research capabilities by producing a final paper based on the group's research findings while developing interdisciplinary skills by combining core concepts in cybersecurity with HCI research methods to investigate the research topic effectively
- Gained a comprehensive understanding of the importance and challenges of usable privacy and security in the real world applications

name: Yujin Hwang
headline: CS Student at Georgia Institute of Technology
about: Hi! I’m a Computer Science student at Georgia Tech, diving deep into the world of AI and machine learning. I’ve worked on some pretty cool projects, like teaching a neural network to tell apart human and AI-created art, and leading a team to build a platform that keeps your iris data safe from sneaky AI. I’ve also dabbled in making Pac-Man smarter with AI and giving a fresh look to a company’s website. I love playing around with Python, Java, TensorFlow, and all sorts of techy stuff. Right now, I’m helping Georgia Tech’s OIT integrate AI into their systems, making life easier for everyone. When I’m not coding, you’ll probably find me hanging out at security events or brainstorming new ways to make tech more user-friendly. Looking to connect with others who are passionate about tech, AI, and making cool things happen!

projects.description:
Collaborated with a team of five to develop a web application for managing and analyzing data related to the Robson Classification System, which categorizes cesarean section deliveries. Worked closely with a medical professional from Rwanda and a professor at Emory University to ensure clinical accuracy and relevance.

Key Features:

User Authentication: Implemented secure registration and login with token-based authentication.
Survey Management: Developed endpoints to process and store survey results, capturing user inputs and Robson Classification groups.
Data Analysis: Enabled custom data filtering and analysis through robust API support.
Access Control: Established group-based permissions for effective user role management.

Implemented feedforward processing and backpropagation algorithms in Python. This involved creating a Perceptron and a multi-layer NeuralNet class, focusing on functions for feedforward input processing and weight adjustment through backpropagation. The project enhanced my skills in machine learning algorithms and Python programming.

Collaborated in a 5-member team to develop a 2D Dungeon Crawler game using Java and Android Studio, focusing on gameplay and UI improvements.

Implemented Singleton, Strategy, Observer, Factory, and Decorator patterns to enhance code quality and maintainability.

Integrated a dynamic scoring system and complex game mechanics, enhancing player engagement; conducted unit tests to ensure functionality.

name: Levi Roe
headline: 3rd Year Mathematics Major @ GaTech (Prob & Stats) - 3.95 GPA | Private Tutoring Entrepreneur - 300+ Hours | FT Resident Assistant - 1+ Years | Seasonal Construction Engineer - 3+ Years | Musician - Pianist & Saxophonist
about:
OBJECTIVE
To obtain an actuarial position and provide my hard work ethic and profound growth mindset towards improving the profitability and efficiency of all involved companies and services.

Professional Competencies

Computer Science Capabilities: Ability to code in Java and Python and nuanced knowledge for all of microsoft office and outlook (Including Powerpoint & Excel)
Experience in Leadership and Project Lead: Accountable for hundreds of residents along RA experience, Lead coordinator for numerous academic projects, and Lead of numerous large social events as an RA.
Data Analysis & Interpretation: High Proficiency in disciplines related to probability and statistics, particularly in an actuarial setting (GT Actuarial Club)
Self-motivated: A quick learner with a willingness to continually expand knowledge, skills, and experiences

Work Experience

experiences.title: Resident Assistant
experiences.description:
In my position as a Resident Assistant, I developed the following capabilities and achievements...
- Highly proficient ability to work with a co-dependent team (high threshold for teamwork and collaboration)
- Hosted many social and cultural events (25+ events) with high attendance and necessary financial budgeting (Ex: Hosted 200+ attendees @ picnic movie night w/ $650 budget allocated between necessary hardware and food; Led/delegated multiple RA teams to set up and gather necessary resources and to advertise)
- Unbiased/Objective, concise, and detailed report writing (Incident, Maintenance, Policy Violation, Information, and etc. reports).
- Peer guidance, conflict mediation, support systems, mentorship, and other vital interpersonal communication disciplines.
- Extensive time management and calendaring along with a high threshold of organizational requirement (Balancing administrative duty with academic responsibility)
Overall: Necessity for leadership, requirement of efficient communication, flexing of organizational and technical skills, and most importantly intense exposure to a professional/corporate workplace.

experiences.title: Private STEM Tutor
experiences.description:
In my position as a private Mathematics and Physics Tutor, I developed the following capabilities and achievements...
- Academic interaction with hundreds of peers and coworkers (High School Freshman -> Adult Students)
- 300+ hours of combined paid and unpaid tutoring hours (primarily mathematics, physics, and Computer Science)
- Simplified complex concepts for students, leading to higher/passing final grades, furthered understanding, achievement of GED's, a breakthrough in projects, etc.
- Exceptional communication skills and the uncommon ability to adapt approaches to teaching/leading according to the uniqueness of diverse individuals.
- Impromptu/In-the-moment critical thinking skills and depth of understanding. This also comes with an understanding of the volume of preparation needed for a true understanding of any subject matter.
- Much deeper understanding for customer service, general business/advertising strategies, and financial/resource/time delegation in a business context
Overall: Developed the ability to simplify complex problems and utilize critical thinking in stressful-situations, and, most importantly, discover the importance of the basic fundamentals of a business model and advertisement strategy.

experiences.title: Construction Engineer
experiences.description:
In Construction Engineering, I developed the following capabilities and achievements...
- Efficient project management and oversight over vital aspects of a project or build, including complex coordination with other teams.
- Critical thinking and daily troubleshooting with strong emphasis on safe practice and proper protocol.
- Eye for fine detail and quality craftsmanship/work, especially in terms of a project's sustainability or effectiveness or longevity.
- Take a blueprint (plan of action) on paper and materialize it efficiently into action (Ex: A wraparound cornered residential porch (abnormal porch build) required a double band support and custom column support positioning and custom floor joist spacing with a border composite board to diagonal decking pattern with Trex railings and column covers).
- Effective collaboration in a team of project partners (Ex: A large project required installation of both new cabinetry and new countertops and flooring, so the job required objective cross-collaboration and time management to avoid conflicting workspaces and any unnecessary timeframe extensions).
- Proficient use of power equipment (both common and advanced machinery).
Overall: Strategic Planning, Creative Ingenuity, and Effective Intra-Departmental Collaboration Practices.

educations.description:
3.95 GPA; Studies in Applied Mathematics;
- Advanced Mathematics (Real Analysis, Abstract Algebra, Combinatorics, 2nd Linear Algebra, Number Theory, etc.)
- Computer Science (Proficiency in Python and Java)
- Microsoft Office (Proficiency in Word, Excel, Powerpoint, and Outlook)
- Critical Thinking (Problem Solving Skills developed for Statistical Analysis\Actuarial Sciences, Software/Programming, and the Corporate Environment)
- Public Speaking, Group Project Dynamics/Efficiency, and Intrapersonal Skills
Overall: Substantial increase in academic and career capability, developed corporate-level skill in data analysis/actuarial analysis and software coding/programming, and developed the work ethic necessary for a prestigious academic/career performance.
4.5 GPA

projects.project_name: Therapute | International Top 10, 2024 Google Student Developer Challenge | Winner, Regeneron HealthTech Innovators | PitchRX Finalist
projects.description:
• Developed MERN application that provides physical therapy patients real-time pose correction feedback for their at-home exercises.
• Utilized dynamic time warping to compare exercise form, and developed a Neural Radiance Field with an Intel Developer Cloud CUDA environment to generate 3D scans of any given user to illustrate the impact of their body type on the style of performance for their assigned exercises.
• Integrated application with an LLM to gain user insight into their exercise experience, which was then summarized into a report for therapists.
• Built a dashboard for physical therapists to read our LLM-summary reports, filter through patient video analysis, provide their own comments, and use provided metrics to assign exercises dynamically between physical therapy sessions.

projects.project_name: VigilAI | Winner, Home Depot: Securing and Validating Large Language Models
projects.description:

• Engineered MERN application to deliver real-time incident reports with AI-generated summaries to station managers.
• Implemented LLM-driven personalized training quizzes to enhance officer response.

• Created personal personal blog for cinema reviews and sports analysis.
• Designed layout on Figma, implemented it using WordPress, Elementor, HTML, and CSS for a seamless user experience.
• Created visually engaging posters and media using Canva to complement the blog's content.
• Authored and published in-depth blog posts featuring movie reviews and statistical evaluations of international cricket matches.

• Developed and deployed a Tenzies game using React.js, with a GitHub repository showcasing numerous commits and a codebase achieving a high maintainability score.
• Implemented Firebase for robust two-factor authentication.
• Leveraged Firebase for efficient storage of user-specific data, including lowest time and number of tries.
